title: Our Editorial Process and Standards
content:
Our Editorial Process and Standards

Read about how we ensure accuracy, compassion, and transparency in every article we produce.

Table of Contents

Our Mission
Important Disclaimer
Our Editorial Process and Content Standards
Ensuring Content Integrity and Accuracy
Evidence-Based Information for Families
Medical Expert Review Process
Transparency and Accountability
Commitment to Clear Communication
Diversity, Inclusion, and Accessibility
Your Trusted Source

Our Mission

Helping children with autism thrive through personalized, compassionate care.

Every family deserves in-home ABA therapy backed by evidence-based practices tailored to meet each child’s needs.

Whether you’re looking for a trusted therapy provider or are already part of the Prospera community, feel confident knowing your child’s growth and progress are our top priorities in a safe, nurturing environment.

Important Disclaimer

Prospera Healthcare’s content is for informational and educational purposes only.

It is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.

Our Editorial Process and Content Standards

Prospera Healthcare is dedicated to providing families with accurate, trustworthy, and compassionate information about autism care.

Our editorial process is grounded in evidence-based research and driven by a team of experienced healthcare professionals.

Every piece of content we create is designed to empower families and help them make informed decisions about their child’s care.

Ensuring Content Integrity and Accuracy

We hold ourselves to the highest editorial standards to ensure that every article, resource, and guide is clear, reliable, and grounded in science.

Evidence-Based Information for Families

Our content is based on the latest research and clinical expertise.

Articles are regularly reviewed by Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) to ensure they reflect the most current best practices in ABA therapy.

Medical Expert Review Process

All content is thoroughly reviewed by a team of experts in autism care and behavioral therapy before publishing.

This ensures that what you read is accurate and aligns with the latest autism treatment research.

Transparency and Accountability

Information in the field of autism care evolves quickly.

We routinely evaluate our content to stay current with the latest research, guidelines, and standards.

If new evidence emerges or treatment guidelines change, we immediately update our resources to reflect those developments.

Commitment to Clear Communication

Autism care is complex, and we believe in making that information accessible to everyone.

Our goal is to break down complicated topics into clear, understandable language without losing the depth or accuracy of the content.

Diversity, Inclusion, and Accessibility

We are committed to reflecting the diverse experiences of the families we serve.

Our content is developed with input from experts, parents, and advocates from various backgrounds.

This helps ensure our content is inclusive, representative, and culturally sensitive.

We actively seek contributions from writers, editors, and healthcare professionals from underrepresented communities to ensure a broad perspective on autism care.

Your Trusted Source

Every article you read from Prospera Healthcare is part of our commitment to providing accurate, compassionate, and reliable information.

Whether learning about ABA therapy or exploring support resources, we want you to feel empowered and confident in your decisions.

We invite you to contact our team with any questions or feedback about our editorial process or content.

Every family deserves in-home ABA therapy backed by evidence-based practices tailored to meet each child’s needs. Whether you’re looking for a trusted therapy provider or […]

title: Terms of Service
content:
Terms of Service

Last updated: September 18, 2024

1. Acceptance of Terms

By using Prospera Healthcare’s website and services, you agree to these Terms of Service.

2. Description of Service

Prospera Healthcare provides in-home Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy for children in Texas, delivered by licensed therapists and Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs).

3. User Responsibilities

  • Provide accurate and complete information when scheduling appointments
  • Adhere to scheduled appointment times
  • Please notify us of cancellations or rescheduling needs promptly
  • Maintain a safe and appropriate environment for in-home therapy sessions

4. Cancellation and Attendance Policy

  • Please cancel appointments with at least 24 hours notice.
  • If you cancel with less than 24 hours notice, a $50 cancellation fee may apply.
  • No-shows will incur a $100 fee.
  • Consistent cancellations or no-shows may result in termination of services.
  • We strive to maintain at least 80% attendance for optimal therapy outcomes.

5. Sick Child Policy and Health/Safety Procedures

  • Please cancel the appointment if your child has a fever over 100°F or shows symptoms of contagious illness.
  • Our therapists will follow proper hygiene and safety protocols during sessions.
  • We reserve the right to cancel sessions if we believe there’s a health risk.

6. Payment and Insurance

  • We bill insurance companies for our services where applicable.
  • You are responsible for any co-pays, deductibles, or fees not covered by insurance.
  • Cancellation fees cannot be billed to insurance.

7. Privacy and HIPAA Compliance

We are committed to protecting your privacy and complying with HIPAA regulations. For more information, please refer to our Privacy Policy.

8. Limitation of Liability

Prospera Healthcare is not liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages resulting from your use of our services.

9. Termination of Services

We reserve the right to terminate services for repeated policy violations, non-payment, or if we can no longer effectively serve your needs.

10. Changes to Terms

We may modify these terms at any time. We will notify users of any significant changes.

11. Governing Law

The laws of the State of Texas shall govern these Terms of Service.

12. Contact Information

If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please get in touch with us at:

Prospera Healthcare
4351 Cross Timbers Rd Suite 400 Flower Mound, TX 75028
Email: info@prosperahealthcare.com
Phone: (972) 900-2488 Hours: 9 AM – 5 PM, Monday to Friday

title: About Us
content:
Prospera Healthcare delivers expert in-home ABA therapy across Texas, serving North Texas, El Paso, and San Antonio areas.
TEXAS ABA THERAPY

Cultivating Success In Every Child

Make an Appointment

Currently welcoming new families in North Texas, El Paso, and San Antonio.
  • Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs)
  • In-network with major insurance providers
  • Free initial consultation

Our Mission

Prospera Healthcare empowers individuals with autism and their families through innovative and compassionate Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy, unlocking potential and fostering meaningful progress.
Prospera Healthcare

Our Values

Our values of Partnership, Progress, Perseverance, and Play guide our collaborative approach to therapy, ensuring continuous advancement, resilience in the face of challenges, and an engaging, enjoyable experience for families and children alike.

Partnership

We collaborate with families, children, clinicians, and staff to provide personalized, family-centered therapy. Together, we achieve better outcomes.

Progress

Your child's advancement is our focus. We continuously evaluate and adjust our approach to ensure forward momentum, overcoming obstacles as they arise.

Perseverance

We face challenges with determination. Our team is committed to finding solutions that work best for your family, navigating complex situations with patience and creativity.

Play

Learning should be enjoyable. We incorporate fun into our therapy sessions, creating an engaging environment that encourages participation and progress for children and families alike.
Locations

Serving Texas Families

Prospera Healthcare is committed to supporting children with autism and their loved ones in communities throughout Texas.
North Texas
Serving the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex and surrounding areas with personalized ABA therapy programs tailored to each child's unique needs.
San Antonio
Bringing innovative ABA interventions to families in San Antonio and the surrounding region, helping children with autism reach their full potential.
El Paso
Offering comprehensive ABA services to El Paso families, supporting children with autism in developing essential skills for a brighter future.

Expert Care
Personalized
Evidence Based

Proven Results

In-Home 1:1 ABA Therapy

Customized one-on-one sessions enhance communication, social skills, and daily living abilities while reducing challenging behaviors.

Behavioral Intervention

Intensive therapy for young children builds crucial developmental foundations for long-term success and independence.

Behavior Assessment

In-depth analysis of behavior triggers to create effective, data-driven intervention strategies and management plans.

Skills Assessment

We precisely track your child’s progress using tools like ABLLS, AFLS, and VB-MAPP to evaluate development and skill acquisition.

Parent Training

Learn ABA techniques, behavior management strategies, and communication skills to support your child’s growth at home.

Remote Assessments

Flexible, remote assessments provide expert care and consistent support from any location.
In Home ABA Therapy

We can help

1

Initial Consultation

Contact us for a free, no-obligation consultation to discuss your child’s needs and discover how we can help.

Personalized ABA THERAPY

Prospera Healthcare

Your child’s development matters, and the right support can make all the difference. We’re accepting new families in North Texas, San Antonio, and El Paso. Request more information today to learn how personalized, in-home ABA therapy can support your child’s growth and success.
Kyle Coddington
Founder & CEO
  • North Texas
  • San Antonio
  • El Paso

Email Us:

hello@prosperahealthcare.com

Call Us:

(972) 900-2488

Schedule a Consultation

North Texas, El Paso, San Antonio

You’ve taken the first steps. Now, let’s figure out what ABA therapy looks like for your child and whether in-home care is the right fit. Schedule a free consultation to get clear answers and a plan tailored to your child’s needs.
FAQs

In-home ABA Therapy

ABA (Applied Behavior Analysis) therapy is an evidence-based approach focused on understanding and changing behaviors. It breaks down skills into manageable steps, using positive reinforcement to encourage desired behaviors and teach new skills.

ABA therapy addresses various developmental areas including communication, social skills, and daily living skills. Personalized to each child's needs, it aims to enhance independent functioning and has shown significant improvements in behavior, skills, and quality of life.

Many insurance plans cover ABA therapy, especially for children diagnosed with autism. Coverage varies by state, policy, and circumstances. We can help you understand and maximize your benefits.

Our Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) conduct comprehensive assessments to determine if ABA therapy suits your child. We consider their unique needs, strengths, and challenges to develop a personalized treatment plan.

Look for Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) with proper credentials and experience. At Prospera Healthcare, our BCBAs are highly trained and experienced. Contact us to schedule a consultation.
Community Partner

Discover Autism-Friendly Events in DFW

Prospera Healthcare partners with Finding YALL to help families connect with local activities and events designed for autistic children and their families.

Explore Events →

Articles & Resources

ABA Information to support your child’s growth.
Potty Training for Kids with Autism
Toilet training is a big milestone—and for children with autism, it often requires a more thoughtful, personalized approach.
Managing Anger in Children with Autism
The right ABA therapy can transform how your child with autism manages anger – starting today.
Understanding Your Child’s Autism Diagnosis
Receiving an autism diagnosis for your child can feel overwhelming, but it’s also the first step towards understanding and supporting their unique journey.
Parents as Partners in Autism Therapy
Wondering how to make autism therapy more effective? The secret might be closer to home than you think.
Rethinking ABA Therapy
Is ABA truly empowering autistic individuals—or just shaping them to fit society’s mold?
Brain Structure Differences in Autism
New research reveals unique brain structure differences in children with autism, shedding light on potential breakthroughs in diagnosis and treatment.
Financial Resources for ABA Therapy
Funding ABA therapy can be challenging, but numerous financial resources, from grants to state programs, can help families access this critical support.
Child Autism Statistics
With autism rates on the rise, understanding the latest statistics is more important than ever for families and advocates.
What You Should Know About ABA Therapy
Considering ABA therapy for your child? Every parent needs to know how it works, its benefits, and how it can help your child thrive.
Questions to Ask ABA Providers
Choosing the right ABA therapy provider for your child’s in-home care is a big decision. Here’s what you should ask to make the best choice for your family.

title: Privacy Policy
content:
Privacy Policy

Last updated: September 18, 2024

1. Introduction

Prospera Healthcare (“we,” “our,” or “us”) is committed to protecting the privacy of our clients and their families. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our website or services.

2. Information We Collect

We collect the following information:

  • Names of parents/guardians and children
  • Contact information (email addresses, phone numbers, physical addresses)
  • Medical and health information related to ABA therapy
  • Financial information for billing purposes
  • Information provided through our website or during therapy sessions

3. How We Use Your Information

We use the collected information to:

  • Provide and improve our ABA therapy services
  • Schedule and manage appointments
  • Communicate with you about our services
  • Process insurance claims and payments
  • Comply with legal and regulatory requirements

4. Information Sharing and HIPAA Compliance

We are committed to maintaining the confidentiality of your health information in compliance with HIPAA. We may share your information with:

  • Our licensed technicians and BCBAs to provide services
  • Insurance companies for billing purposes
  • Other healthcare providers involved in your care, with your consent
  • Government agencies, when required by law

We will not sell or rent your personal information to third parties for marketing purposes.

5. Security Measures

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information, including:

  • Encryption of sensitive data
  • Regular security audits
  • Employee training on data protection
  • Secure, password-protected storage systems

However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure.

6. Your Rights

You have the right to:

  • Access your personal information
  • Request corrections to your personal information
  • Request deletion of your personal information, subject to our legal obligations
  • Opt-out of specific data uses
  • Receive a copy of your medical records

To exercise these rights, please get in touch with us at info@prosperahealthcare.com or call us at (972) 900-2488.

7. Children’s Privacy

We collect information about children only with parental consent and to provide ABA therapy services. We comply with all applicable laws regarding children’s privacy.

8. Use of Tracking Technologies and Cookies

We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to improve user experience and analyze website usage. You can control cookie settings through your browser preferences.

9. Communication Preferences

You can choose whether to receive promotional communications from us. To opt-out, please get in touch with us at info@prosperahealthcare.com or (972) 900-2488, or use the unsubscribe link in our emails.

10. Public Forums

We do not currently offer public forums on our website. If this changes, we will update this policy accordingly.

11. Updates to Privacy Policy

We may update this policy from time to time. We will notify you of any significant changes by posting the new policy on this page and updating the “Last updated” date.

12. Specific Considerations for ABA Therapy and In-Home Services

  • Our therapists maintain confidentiality of all information observed or obtained during in-home sessions.
  • We have specific protocols for handling and storing therapy session notes and progress reports.

13. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please get in touch with us at:

Prospera Healthcare
4351 Cross Timbers Rd Suite 400 Flower Mound, TX 75028
Email: info@prosperahealthcare.com
Phone: (972) 900-2488
Hours: 9 AM – 5 PM, Monday to Friday
